thread.title: ​​Is This Obscure Wall Street Invention Responsible for the Market Selloff?

author: Corrie Driebusch
title: ​​Is This Obscure Wall Street Invention Responsible for the Market Selloff?
text:
The surge in market volatility this week, after a long period of tranquility, left investors seeking a culprit. Critics began pointing to an obscure investment strategy pioneered by the world’s largest hedge fund, Bridgewater Associates.
So-called risk-parity funds aim to reduce the danger from a collapse in any one market by limiting bets on more volatile assets like stocks and commodities and using leverage to load up on safer assets like government bonds.
